conclusion: Use principles of refraction and reflection in a prism to find refractive index and distance between points P and C.
Prism is a square, incident angle at point M is 60 degrees, ray enters from M, exits from P, and reflects at N on BC side.
Angle of incidence at point M is 60 degrees, equal to angle of reflection.
Angle of refraction is equal to angle of incidence, thus 60 degrees.
Refractive index n is calculated using n = 1/sin(θ), where θ is 60 degrees, resulting in n = 2/√3 ≈ 1.154.
Distance between points P and C is the same as distance between M and N, calculated as a/2 where a is the side length of the square.
